verdict.summary: Git's filter process protocol encounters an error, typically when git-lfs is configured in .gitattributes but the git-lfs binary is not installed or not found in PATH.

dead_ends.why_fails: This disables LFS tracking for the entire repo; large files become checked in directly, bloating the repository permanently

dead_ends.action: Downgrading git version to avoid filter-process protocol
dead_ends.why_fails: Older git versions use the single-file filter protocol which is slower and still fails if the filter binary is missing

workarounds.action: Install git-lfs and run git lfs install
workarounds.how: Install git-lfs via package manager (apt install git-lfs, brew install git-lfs), then run git lfs install to register the filter hooks globally.

workarounds.action: Unset the filter if LFS is not needed
workarounds.how: If LFS is not needed, remove LFS entries from .gitattributes and run git config --global --unset filter.lfs.process

leads_to.condition: when filter process starts but fails during object download

preceded_by.condition: when smudge errors are the root cause of the filter process failure

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Filter-process-failed means the filter binary itself crashed or is missing; smudge error means the filter ran but could not download the LFS object
